project.teaser: The HEPHAESTUS project is built around one key, overarching objective:To develop a set of scalable and tuneable unit operations, to be built as integrated processing plant, featuring the capacity to treat multiple process wastes deriving from primary mineral and metallurgical...
project.objective: The HEPHAESTUS project is built around one key, overarching objective: To develop a set of scalable and tuneable unit operations, to be built as integrated processing plant, featuring the capacity to treat multiple process wastes deriving from primary mineral and metallurgical (primary and secondary) streams. The unit operations are: - Clean-Tech electric furnace, to transform the EAF and AOD dust into metal alloy to be immediately remelted, process supported with streams of fines by-products from the mineral primary extractions (construction, aggregates and dimensional stone) - EZINEX process, to extract the zinc present in the dust of the furnace - Fibre drawing, for mineral wool manufacturing out of the process slag in molten state - Catalytic conversion of CO2 gas into methanol or formic acid - Ammonia-ammonium carbonate (AAC) and methanesulfonic acid (MSA) based hydrometallurgical processes, to produce a recyclable Fe-rich residue and to recover metals (e.g.e.g., ZnS) from EAF dust The project is targeting primarily small-scale applications (order of magnitude 10 k tons waste dust per year), to cope with the typically fragmented European process size. Such scale is matching the waste volumes and differentiation and granting positive environmental AND economic sustainability through the valorisation of different streams of by-products at low operational and capital expenditure, ensuring vast replicability and short ROI Project will be demonstrated in two pilot applications, in Greece and Italy, with the purpose of creating awareness on the business potential and to generate the conditions for a long-term exploitation, leading to meaningful reduction of wastes for the extractive and steel industries.
project.title: Heavy and Extractive industry wastes PHAsing out through ESG Tailings Upcycling Synergy
project.keywords: Steel Dust recycling, Recovery of mineral fine dust tailings, Process circular economy, Industrial synergy, EAF and AOD dust recycling, mineral wool, Zinc, Carbon Capture and Transformation, Methanol

article.title: Recovering important metals from low-grade ores and waste

result.title: Transforming CO2 into Synthetic Fuels: Modeling, Simulation, and Optimization Analysis of Methanol Production from Industrial Wastes

details.authors: Vasiliki Kontou; Antonis Peppas; Sotiris Kottaridis; Chrysa Politi; Sotirios Karellas

result.title: Resource mapping report of other waste streams or by products suitable for HEPHAESTUS technologies
result.description: Report providing insight into the waste streams available within the most relevant mining and primary metallurgical plants in Europe. Classification of the mineral resources in terms of composition and volumes, for the potential blending and application as fluxes and slag modification for the processPreliminary TOC: - Introduction - Main mining and refinement sites in EU - Composition of the dusts (quali-quantitative) - Preliminary identification of Potential mining clusters - ConclusionsDeliverable is associated to Task 2.2

result.title: Resource mapping report on EAF and AOD dust produced from the steel making industry
result.description: The report provides extensive insight in the volumes and composition of the typical byproducts and wastes from the most relevant steel districts and manufacturers in EU. Mapping of the results is relevant in order to address the business opportunities to identify preferred future servicing or industrial locationsPreliminary TOC: - Introduction - Main EAF production sites in EU - Composition of the dusts (quali-quantitative) and relation to steel process - Preliminary identification of Potential clusters of steel manufacture - ConclusionsDeliverable is associated to Task 2.1

result.title: Carbon Capture Utilisation and Storage in Extractive Industries for Methanol Production

details.authors: Antonis Peppas; Sotiris Kottaridis; Chrysa Politi; Panagiotis M. Angelopoulos

result.title: Thermodynamic and Kinetic Analysis of a CO2 Hydrogenation Pilot Scale Reactor for Efficient Methanol Production

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - HEPHAESTUS (Heavy and Extractive industry wastes PHAsing out through ESG Tailings Upcycling Synergy)
result.teaser: The HEPHAESTUS project adopts a comprehensive approach to address dusty wastes from metallurgic processes, creating a circular economy. These wastes pose environmental challenges due to the annual production of steel in the European Union countries. Approximately 40% of this...

category.title: Report Summary

result.title: Plan for Dissemination of Results
result.description: Report describing the plan for the dissemination activities to be delivered during the course of the whole project durationPreliminary TOC Introduction Communication Materials Plan For Public awareness Plan for industrial engagement and advisory through Stakeholders committee and expert panel Plan for scientific awareness and publication ConclusionsDeliverable is associated to Task 71

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
